pullRequest.title: Fix incorrect result when aggregating count BigQuery view
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #5635
We can choose executing SELECT count(*) FROM view on BigQuery or reading number of rows from generated _pbc table. This PR is former.

nodes.bodyText: Can you please add two rows to a table, so the expected count(*) with and without filters is different?

Notice that unless there's some caching on the materialized tables references, then any call to count(*) will trigger a new query and create a new table - incurring additional costs on the users. Another approach is to trigger a sql SELECT COUNT(*) FROM view and use the result, which will give BigQuery the option to use some optimizations.

commit.message: Fix incorrect result when aggregating count BigQuery view

afterCommit.message: Fix incorrect result when aggregating count BigQuery view
